attributes.action: Establish penalties against companies for systematic late payment of invoices
attributes.background: Freelancers make up 15% of the UK workforce, yet there has been little change in legislation to support this shift. In particular the lack of appropriate legislation around payment terms gives freelancers little practical power to ensure terms are enforced - resulting in serious cash flow issues.
attributes.additional_details:
A small survey of freelancers (97 people) found that everyone had experienced late payment and 37.5% had to wait over 6 months to be paid - some people were never paid. Companies should simply not be allowed to operate like this.

Options currently available include taking a company to small claims court, which is costly & time consuming, and late payment fines which are an inadequate solution as again require the invoice to at some point be paid - and don't fix cash flow issues.

attributes.action: Legal requierment for A/C to be working correctly on Public Service Vehicles
attributes.background: Working as a Bus Driver in London I frequently come across buses where the Heaters and/or Air Conditioning (A/C) is not working correctly as the operator is NOT legally required to maintain them. Therefore, I feel it‚Äôs about time that it is a legal requirement for Heaters and A/C to be working.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, you cannot transport cattle at temperatures higher than 30C, so why do people not have similar legal rights to travel in comfort. If you agree then please sign the petition and share.

attributes.action: Make it law to scan microchips routinely on current & new patients at the vets.
attributes.background:
As the public & dog owners who see our dogs & cats as part of our family we would expect all vets to scan them. 
If a dog or cat goes missing and then found and kept by someone or is stolen and sold on they have little chance of ever being found & reunited with their family as most vets never scan
attributes.additional_details:
In reality if they were brought into a vets somewhere they're chip would definitely most likely not be checked. 
I have moved around the UK over the years & I have belonged to approx 11 different practices & not one offered to scan my dogs. I had to request it and luckily I did as 1 of my dogs chip had dissaperared. He is now chipped again to be safe. Scanning new & old patients microchips would reunite so many. It doesn't take long & reception staff could also easily do this. 

DogsAreFamily üíî

attributes.action: Stop the Oxford-Cambridge Expressway & all associated ill-conceived development
attributes.background: Disastrous plans for an expressway and 1,000,000 new homes across our Home Counties cannot be allowed to happen. How can Oxfordshire absorb double the amount of houses it currently has?  Similar proposals exist for Buckinghamshire, Bedfordshire, and Cambridge.  Totally unsustainable project.
attributes.additional_details: Guardian newspaper article and other media refers - https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/aug/22/project-britain-debate-oxford-cambridge-expressway

attributes.action: Ensure cancer patients wait for no longer than a week for scan or test results.
attributes.background: There are currently no guidelines which determine how long a cancer patient should be expected to wait for scan or test results. This means that many patients are waiting for several weeks to know their fate. Inevitably, this holds up treatment and can lead to a worse outcome for the patient.
attributes.additional_details: At present patients with suspected cancer may have to wait for 62 days for test results to confirm a diagnosis. For those already diagnosed, there are no time limits for scan or test results. In our increasingly overstretched NHS, scan results are being given too late. This is an unacceptable situation which could be remedied. I am asking the government to ensure no cancer patient has to wait for longer than a week for test results so that their treatment isn't delayed or their choices limited.

attributes.action: Make the use of single-use black plastic for food packaging illegal by 2020
attributes.background: Black plastic is widely used in food packaging and it cannot be recycled in most places.  There are viable alternatives readily available.

attributes.action: Advanced Clinical Practitioners to be able to sign Med 3 forms (FIT notes)
attributes.background: Advanced Clinical Practitioners are heavily involved in patients medical treatments and investigations. They cover the short fall of medical staffing for the NHS. To help save time and efficiency they should be allowed by law to sign the FIT notes. Please reassess this situation.
attributes.additional_details: RCN

attributes.action: Impose legislation to stop charity bags being delivered to homes in the UK
attributes.background: charitybags.org.uk estimate that 525 million charity bags are delivered to homes in England & Wales per year ‚Äì this would equate to 2,625 tonnes of plastic.
attributes.additional_details: They say only 3% are filled, meaning that a staggering 509 million bags may be ending up in landfill, contributing to the worldwide plastic problem.

attributes.action: Ban The Sale of Live Plucked Down Products In The United Kingdom.
attributes.background: China supplies 80% of the worlds down. Geese are forcefully restrained and feathers ripped out. This process is repeated every 6-7 weeks, causing birds considerable pain and distress. Many are left with gaping wounds, some even die.
attributes.additional_details:
Workers often sew the birds‚Äô skin back together without anaesthetic.
Down is still widely used in the UK Fashion and Bedding Industries with most supplied by China. Make it compulsory law that retailers only supply down that meets the Responsible Down Standard (RDS) http://responsibledown.org/ and the DOWNPASS standard 2017 https://www.downpass.com/en/downpass/standard.html and ban the sale of all live-plucked down in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Add Fibromyalgia & Rheumatoid Arthritis to NHS exemption fee list
attributes.background: Many diagnosed with these medical conditions both of which are non cureable need medication in order to have a liveable/maybe manageable quality of life.

attributes.action: Launch an independent enquiry into the health and safety risks of 5G.
attributes.background:
As wireless companies prepare to launch the next generation of service, there are new questions about the possible health risks. 
The National Toxicology Program study "was just an indicator that more and better research is needed,"
attributes.additional_details: https://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-5784487/amp/The-roll-5G-wireless-service-massive-health-experiment-public-health-expert-warns-a.html

attributes.action: Move the target deadlines of the 2008 Climate Change Act from 2050 to 2035
attributes.background: The recent IPCC report on climate change, suggests that the process of climate change is accelerating, will have more dramatic effects and is more limited by time . This is grounds to amend the target or baseline year from 2050 to 2035 as outlined in the Climate Change Act; Section 2; Subsection 2.
attributes.additional_details:
The information is summarised in the IPCC report

https://www.ipcc.ch/pdf/session48/pr_181008_P48_spm_en.pdf

Popular press have reported it 
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/oct/08/global-warming-must-not-exceed-15c-warns-landmark-un-report

We need to consider how to reduce our dependency on fossil fuels for our long term future and that of the planet.  The Quaker testimony of stewardship compels me to have to take action at both a local and national level.

http://quaker.org/legacy/northbranch/stewardship.html

attributes.action: Stop the 3.2% increase on rail fares set for 2019 after a disastrous 2018
attributes.background: The UK has some of the most expensive rail ticket prices in Europe. The catastrophic implementation of the 2020 plan show all train companies don't have a customer-centric approach and neglect users. Before raising prices, the government should put in place effective quality control system.

attributes.action: Preserve the rights of EU citizens to stand and vote in local elections.
attributes.background:
Fair and effective local democracy depends on having certainty over who can stand and vote in local elections.

Government should make a commitment, now, that all EU citizens legally resident in the UK should retain their rights to stand as candidates and vote in council elections after Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
An urgent commitment is needed because political parties and independent candidates are already making preparations to campaign in the May 2019 local elections.

Note that this petition is silent about EU residents' rights to remain in the UK.  (That matter, unhelpfully, is still unresolved at the time of writing.)

This petition assures political rights to those EU citizens who are granted, or retain, legal rights to reside in UK.  The criteria for those residency rights is a separate matter.

attributes.action: Commons to vote on the question "Brexit is in the UK's best interest"
attributes.background: Despite the importance of this topic, there has never been a debate in the House of Commons specifically on this question. Parliament's first duty is to always act in what it considers to be the UK's best interest. Hence, that consideration needs to be made and should dictate action.
attributes.additional_details: Commons Briefing Paper 07212 of June 2016, regarding the EU Referendum, makes clear the status that the referendum result would have. Despite this, the result has been taken as a mandate for action. Parliament represents all UK citizens, whether they can and do vote or not, and should not facilitate a vote by c.26% of us as 'the will of the people' but act in what it judges the best interests of the UK and all its people. That judgement must be established.

attributes.action: Create a 26 week scan during pregnancy to reduce the risk of still births.
attributes.background: In 2016 There were 3,430 stillbirths throughout the year in the UK. still births are when the baby dies after 20 weeks. Could this figure be reduced if there was to be an extra scan that takes place at 26 weeks during pregnancy. In 2016 there were 9 stillbirths a day. That is 9 too many.

attributes.action: Condemn the Faroe Islands for allowing the slaughter of endangered Cetaceans.
attributes.background: Every year, up to 1,000 migrating Pilot Whales and other dolphins are hunted and brutally killed in the Faroe Islands in a practice known as the ‚ÄòGrindadr√°p‚Äô (or Grind). The cruel practice continues with the support of the Danish government, in conflict with their international legal obligations.
attributes.additional_details:
"An EU directive prohibits member states from all forms of deliberate disturbance, capture, or killing of cetaceans, however Sea Shepherd has evidence proving that Danish officials from the police, navy, and customs have been facilitating and even actively participating in the Grind." Sea Shepherd UK. 
We demand condemnation and ceasing of tourism and trade relations with the Faroe Islands until the Grind is ended in perpetuity. All evidence available to view on Sea Shepherd UK's Facebook page.

attributes.action: We request a ban on issuing psychiatric drugs to children under 5 years old.
attributes.background: We strongly believe that the risk of potential harm from psychiatric drugs is too great to expose a young child‚Äôs brain to this risk. Countries like France have a ban until seven years of age. More research is needed in this field and caution is required until that point.
attributes.additional_details: We are aware that children as young as two could be being medicated with strong drugs designed for adult use, such as psychostimulants, antipsychotics or antidepressants. We have safeguarding concerns about this growing practice. Increasingly Educational Psychologists in the field are aware of such cases and this causes us great concern.

attributes.action: Fund more bobbies on the streets
attributes.background:
Street crime in our area is at its highest it‚Äôs ever been. 
Whether it be a mugging, theft, assault, burglary, drugs or intimidation of our children. 
Safe streets = safe children.
I‚Äôm sure you would have noticed that the number of on the beat police has dropped (or in some cases non-existent).
attributes.additional_details:
This in turn can breed a higher rate of ‚ÄòStreet Crime‚Äô and invites people into our area to commit offences. 
The more police presence we have on our streets will be a deterrent to these opportunistic criminals coming to our area and doing as they please. The police are understaffed and overworked, therefore can‚Äôt cope with the ever growing issues we are all bearing the brunt of. 
Low police presence = high crime rate 
High police presence = low crime rate

attributes.action: Remove the requirement to pay VAT by churches, specifically on building works.
attributes.background: 20% VAT is payable on extensions and refurbishments by churches (and other bodies) which are being undertaken for local communities, many in deprived areas and the amount taken from any funds raised by the churches makes it, in a lot if instances, difficult to carry out all the work required.
attributes.additional_details: Our church in Denton undertook a refurbishment in 2005 which brought many people & groups into the church & its premises, at a time when councils were closing facilities. Churches help by housing groups that otherwise would have to close, or at least restrict the work that they do. This type of includes working with various health groups, places for the young and old to meet, and much more. We are looking at a ¬£1,000,000 project which incurs ¬£200k in tax, this mean much of it will not be done.

attributes.action: Remove the ban on Tyler, The Creator entering the UK
attributes.background: Tyler The Creator was banned from the UK for controversial lyrics off his debut album Goblin in 2011. The content was clearly intended as adult humour, hasn't incited violence, and the artist has shown overwhelming growth since the record's release. As such, this ban feels petty and should be lifted

attributes.action: Ban the sale of wet wipes that have ‚Äúflushable‚Äù on the packet.
attributes.background:
According the the BBC,‚ÄúAll wet wipes sold as flushable in the UK have failed the industrys disintergration test‚Äù. ‚ÄúFlushable‚Äù wet wipes cause 80% of blockages in sewers and cost around ¬£100m a year.
This money could be reinvested into our ageing infrastructure and could prevent more ocean pollution

attributes.action: make it a criminal offence for a parent to deny contact after a court order
attributes.background: Currently there is nothing preventing a parent from not abiding to a court access order, meaning the non resident parent will have to repeatedly return to court to have it enforced. This has a negative emotional impact on both the parent and children. It's also time consuming and very costly.
attributes.additional_details: The police agree this happens too often, but they cant help because it is not a criminal offence, and can only advise returning to court, but unfortunately this can become a never ending cycle . Some parents even go as far as trying to cut the other parent out Completely, which is known as parental alienation. Research is being done on the negative emotional impact losing time with a loving parent has on children, and the law needs to be updated to reflect this and protect children and families.

attributes.action: Tax on meat and dairy products to offset the damage caused in their production.
attributes.background: According to a news article published in late 2017 the global livestock industry causes 15% of all global greenhouse emissions, furthermore the over consumption of meat in the UK seriously damages health and is associated with hugely elevated heath care costs.
attributes.additional_details:
Excessive meat and dairy production damage both health and the environment. We call upon the government to tax their consumption along the lines of tobacco, alcohol and the burning of fossil fuels.

Research from the University of Oxford suggests surcharges of 40% on meat and 20% on milk would account for the damage their production causes, and reduce the impact of both emissions and unhealthy consumption. We ask the government to discuss the adoption of a tax at these levels.

attributes.action: Amend the Official Secrets Act to prevent its use in cases of child abuse.
attributes.background: The Official Secrets Act may have deterred people from whistleblowing on paedophiles in positions of power. This is contrary to the public interest. We call on the Government to amend the Act to ensure that it can‚Äôt happen again.
attributes.additional_details:
There seem to have been moves to cover up cases of child abuse in order to protect people in power from accusations. This is evidenced by the Interview former chief whip Tim Fortescue gave to Panorama in 1995.
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/28207066/abuse-claims-senior-whip-would-help-colleagues
 
I have campaigned on this issue for 30+ years

attributes.action: Allow use of Medicinal Cannabis for Fibromyalgia and CFS/ME on the NHS
attributes.background: Cannabis is currently a Class B substance, defined as a "drug that has no therapeutic value". I believe that to be untrue. Cannabis-based medicines are already available on the NHS to a select and lucky few.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that no one should have to suffer due to unjust laws and that everyone should have the right to access natural, safe, effective and inexpensive medicine. Fibromyalgia and CFS/ME sufferers have little chance of finding any medication to help their condition. There isn't one specific drug designed for treatment of symptoms. Drugs that are prescribed may have damaging side effects and some patients show little to no improvement after taking them.

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum sentence for shaken baby deaths no guilty plea reduction.
attributes.background: We are calling for a mandatory minimum sentence of 15 years when an offender kills a child through shaking the infant. This should also mean that they are not eligible for the reduction in sentence when pleading guilty to get a lower jail term.
attributes.additional_details: The case of lee sweet who pled guilty to manslaughter of his son should serve as a warning that this should never happen again.  No family should have to wait a year to lay to rest such a precious life, let alone have to watch as he received a third reduction in sentence for pleading guilty after 11 months of denining it.

attributes.action: Amend the law and reclassify the meaning of 'intentionally homeless'.
attributes.background: At present, under the law, tenants who are served 'notice' are encouraged by their local council to remain in their home; for, if they leave, they are bizarrely classified as 'intentionally homeless' and are unlikely to be housed as a priority.
attributes.additional_details: Conventional wisdom would say that if a tenant is served notice by a landlord, then they must leave. However, local councils are increasingly encouraging tenants to remain until a landlord is able to obtain a County Court Judgement in which bailiffs forcibly remove a tenant as this is the only way a tenant can qualify for long-term rehousing under the current law. This is cost prohibitive to both tenants and landlords and must be changed- being served 'notice' is not an act of intentional homelessness

attributes.action: Reopen the Woodhead Railway Line for Ro-Ro Trains to ease the A628 road.
attributes.background: The A628 road is dangerously congested daily, so an option to use RoRo trains between Stockport and Sheffield to take trucks off the Woodhead Pass, this would be economically viable to the transport industry, and reducing the Carbon Footprint Environment for the local communities along the A628.
attributes.additional_details: The A628 road is every day heavily congested, there is a planned project to utilise Roll on Roll off trains taking trucks off the Woodhead Pass, this would be a business cost saving on fuel wear & tare to the haulage industry, and reduce the Carbon Footprint improving the environment for the communities along the A628 route. Also reopening the line allows another cross Penine rail line to ease the pressure of the current Penine Rail routes.

attributes.action: Standardise speed limits for vehicles up to 3500kg
attributes.background: Currently commercial vehicles including light weight vans are limited to 60mph on dual carrageways and 50 mph on single. This causes confusion and frustration for vehicles following.
attributes.additional_details: Not everyone is aware of this rule and probably wonder why vans are traveling slowly, holding up traffic, forcing following vehicles to overtake which can be hazardous. People who are unaware of the rule can find themselves with an unnecessary speeding ticket.

attributes.action: Address the discrepancies in widening accesss scheme payments across NHS trusts
attributes.background:
1000‚Äôs of NHS workers are out of pocket after being wrongly taxed by bosses. They have been caught in a payroll error that docked their cash on training allowances and scholarships.
But instead of an instant rebate, the staff are having to sort out the tax mess with individual Trusts and HMRC.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/shambolic-confusing-system-sees-thousands-9197458.amp

attributes.action: Total ban on killing and eating of dogs and cats in uk
attributes.background: Total ban and new legislation to make the killing of cats and dogs for the purpose of food consumption illegal in the UK. The current law is that it is illegal to sell dog meat through licensed channels to the public, but actually eating dog and cat meat is not a specifically banned practice in UK.
attributes.additional_details: Daily mail article dated 6th August 2018

attributes.action: End Forced Academisation: Repeal Section 7 (Education and Adoption Act, 2016)
attributes.background: We call on the government to urgently issue an amendment to the Academies Act 2010 as updated by Section 7 from the Education and Adoption Act 2016, to remove the Secretary of State for Education‚Äôs power to issue ‚Äòacademy orders‚Äô to schools which have been given an ‚Äòinadequate‚Äô Ofsted judgement.
attributes.additional_details:
The John Roan, Greenwich; Littlegreen Special School, Compton and Springfield Primary, Birmingham are facing forced academisation despite widespread opposition. 
 
Academisation has created fragmented provision, reduced accountability and democratic control, and the proliferation of obscene CEO salaries. Concerns about academisation include the exclusion of SEND children and the use of ‚Äòoff-rolling‚Äô by MATs who seek to improve their position in the league tables; meaning children could be denied access to education. The law must change.

attributes.action: To have a second referendum on Britain leaving the EU
attributes.background:
It's no secret that a vast amount of people who voted to leave the EU didn't realise what they were voting for. 

The Leave campaign said that leaving would create new trade deals, strengthen the economy and public services and reduce the number of incoming immigrants. But this is not happening.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May has really struggled so far in Brexit negotiations and time is running out. She's failing to secure trade deals and my personal biggest fear is the Irish Border, this could lead to a United Ireland.

May has lost support not only from the Cabinet but the whole nation. I'm calling for a second referendum, because if you voted to remain or to leave we need a final say. The Brexit decision was so tight and I just think that it help everyone if there was a second vote. Sign if you agree.

attributes.action: Stop Universal Credit and let claimants stay on the original benefits.
attributes.background: Universal Credit is a disgrace and forcing people on to the benefit is so cruel. It shouldn‚Äôt have been introduced. Many families are living are in debt, living in poverty, some claimants have took their own lives which is saddening.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May / The Government needs to put a stop to this and fast. People can‚Äôt make ends meet and and as said people took their own lives, families living in poverty what not evidence Is there ?

People‚Äôs lives have been and are still being ruined.

attributes.action: To make the Drug MDPV Monkey Dust Class A, users need support also
attributes.background: Monkey Dust is causing so much trouble to services up and down the country and destroying the lives of many people. People who take this drug are ending up in Prisons, while others are harming themselves without been aware of their own personal injuries.
attributes.additional_details: The local and national media have reported a massive rise in the use of this drug and communities have been effected through crimes such as robberies.

attributes.action: Reject calls to add American Bulldogs to the dangerous dog act.
attributes.background: Peta, an organization that is meant to dedicated to the protection of animals has called on the UK government that it should add American bulldogs to the dda, effectively banning them outright. Breed specific legislation is nout an effective solution. I suggest the law notices deed not breed

attributes.action: Fund afamelanotide on the NHS to treat erythropoietic protoporphyria
attributes.background: Erythropoietic Protoporphyria is a life changing genetic condition, your body has a reaction when exposed to UV and visible light. You can't go out without covering head to toe, just to be able to leave the house. Inside all blinds must be closed, also lights to be checked. No prevention or cure.
attributes.additional_details:
Reactions mean weeks of agony. You feel like your blood is on fire, pain beyond words that no medication touches. Skin dries and cracks. You can‚Äôt talk, eat, and  struggle to drink. It can also lead to liver failure and Vitamin D and iron deficiencies. 
 
There is a treatment that works and other countries are using it but NICE has said no, because it‚Äôs too expensive. We are pleading for the government to fund this treatment and give EPP sufferers a chance of a normal life

attributes.action: Give free fruit to Early Years Settings the same as schools
attributes.background: As a charity setting providing care for children under 5 we are passionate in providing young children with the best start in life by embedding healthy practices from the very start. At present children of infant school age are given free fruit which is great but this should start much earlier
attributes.additional_details:
Quoted from the NHS, Fruit and vegetables are a good source of the nutrients that children need and form part of a healthy, balanced diet.
Research shows that on average children in England only eat about 3 portions, with many eating fewer.
The scheme for schools suggests that this also helps to increase awareness of the importance of eating fruit and vegetables, encouraging healthy eating habits that can be carried into later life, so surely this should start as early as possible.

attributes.action: Ban the use of glyphosate in the UK
attributes.background:
Since classified a probable carcinogen, many are saying NO to glyphosate.

Why not prove chemicals safe before allowing use? 

UK GOV If you take your duty of care seriously, you would ban it now, pending review, as there is no proof it does not cause illnesses & mounting evidence it does.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is on behalf of ‚ÄòAgainst Glyphosate Europe‚Äô - A networking, solidarity and information exchange group for European based campaigners wanting to effect Glyphosate bans. (Can be found on facebook)

Reasons to ban: 

1)	Dewayne Johnson against Monsanto - www.theguardian.com/business/2018/aug/11/one-mans-suffering-exposed-monsantos-secrets-to-the-world

2)	WHO: ‚Äòprobably carcinogenic‚Äô 

3)	Glyphosate can cause cancer: www.euronews.com/2016/07/01/glyphosate-can-cause-cancer

4) Many countries banning it

Too many more to list - do your research

attributes.action: Any parent convicted of a child sexual offence to be stripped of parental rights
attributes.background: As it stands both parents have joint parental rights and responsibilities of their children if born from 2003 whether married or not.
attributes.additional_details: Convicted Paedophiles and sex offenders with children born from 2003 still have legal rights and responsibilities over their children. This needs to change as no parent or guardian should have to fight in a family court to have those right revoked.

attributes.action: Remove compulsory GCSE English and maths resits for 16-18 year olds students
attributes.background: Compulsory GCSE resits do not apply to Apprentices or T Level students who may be enrolled on Functional Skills. Teachers should be allowed to select the most appropriate type of English and maths qualification for a students' onward progression, rather than being mandated by a Condition of Funding
attributes.additional_details: Government must change this failed and costly policy which shows that three-quarters of young people who failed to achieve a GCSE in English and maths at age 16, have still not achieved them by age 19 despite multiple attempts. FE professionals should be allowed to choose the most appropriate qualification linked to a student's intended destination. The AoC, AELP, and ASCL have called for the policy to be scrapped, with Ofsted stating that there are "serious questions" about it. Let's change it!

attributes.action: Allow the summer 2019 gcse literature exam paper to be open book. (For quotes)
attributes.background: The current upcoming summer exam papers for gcse literature is a closed book test - and while this has been petitioned before, there are a few specific - yet vital - points that the government failed to discuss during their conclusion...
attributes.additional_details: The government responded, stating that the exam boards supply the candidate with a relevant extract to the question; while this is the case, the candidate is capped at 15 marks out of 30 if they do not mention somewhere else in the play - relevant to the question. This, in turn, means that they will require to memorise various sections of the play (or novel) just so that they can get more than half marks on the question. Getting half marks overall is a current grade 4 which is not even a pass.

attributes.action: Establish a special unit to tackle the misconduct of public officials.
attributes.background:
Abuse of the public's trust has become normalised: it is simply accepted as the way things are and not treated as the criminal offence that it is.
The police cannot get involved in political decisions and for this reason have proven too cautious over this offence, hence the need for a special unit.
attributes.additional_details:
Taking the nation to war on a lie or rending the nation asunder with a promise that there is no intention of keeping are serious abuses of the public's trust, or at least they appear so to me. 

https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/misconduct-public-office

Too often we hear tales of public officers abusing their powers to line their pockets or conceal their wrongdoings, yet we almost never hear of these things being investigated. This need to stop.

attributes.action: The Saudi Arabian Ambassador should be expelled.
attributes.background: The Saudi armed forces are attacking Yemen with bad reconnaissance. The result is the large scale killing of innocent civilians. The Saudi authorities permit this situation to perpetuate.
attributes.additional_details: At least 29 children have been killed and 30 wounded in a Saudi-led coalition air strike in Yemen, the International Committee of the Red Cross says. The children were travelling on a bus that was hit at a market in Dahyan, in the northern province of Saada. The health ministry run by the rebel Houthi movement put the death toll at 43, and said 61 people were wounded. The coalition, which is backing Yemen's government in a war with the Houthis, said its actions were "legitimate".

attributes.action: Stop sex offenders being held at Hollesley Bay prison
attributes.background: Hollesley bay is an open prison with a public access road right through its grounds. There is a primary school within a 4 minute walk and areas open to the public where people take their children to play.

attributes.action: Pass a law so that food labels must state exactly which ingredients they contain
attributes.background:
There have been several high profile cases of allergies causing death where the food labelling has not been correct.

Those with allergies can't eat a vast range of food due to the labels stating 'may contain'. For example, may contain nuts... Which nuts? Actual ingredients only should be listed.

attributes.action: Change the rules on accessibility to schools to match that of planning.
attributes.background: Planning applications are judged as being accessible when within a walking distance of 2km and cycling distance of 5km to amenities.  The rules for school children should match this.  This should mean safe cycle routes for a significant amount of the current 3 mile walking distance.
attributes.additional_details:
To walk 3miles takes about an hour, whilst cycling this distance would take about 20 minutes. This reduces the amount of time children have at home to study or attend extra curricular activities.
If walking upto 2km for adults is suitable then how can the government justify the 3miles(5km) for children as young as 11?
We would like the rules changed so that those traveling upto 3 miles will have a safe cycle route most of the distance and be able to travel with a cycle the rest of the way.

attributes.action: Repeal the two child limit to Tax Credits and Universal Credit.
attributes.background:
It is a glaring injustice. It breaks the link between the assessment of children‚Äôs needs and the support they receive. 
It will worsen child poverty.  
Not all women have control over their reproductive destiny. Compulsory disclosure requirements will re-traumatise rape victims.
attributes.additional_details:
Many women will never disclose rape to anyone. Reasons include trauma, self-protection, shame, and fear for others - including their child. To force them to do so is cruel and risks danger.
There is already evidence that it is influencing decisions on pregnancy termination.
How could it be paid for?
The Government says the two child limit will save just over a ¬£1bn in 2019/20. Since the policy was announced, OBR forecasts for spending on personal tax credits in 2019/20 have reduced by ¬£2.2bn.

attributes.action: All children's bicycles sold in the UK to have handlebar plugs fitted.
attributes.background: Children are injured, and even killed, by the handlebars of their own bikes. These deaths are preventable. I would like to update British Standards. Initially through an immediate voluntary action and then into BS EN 16054 (BMX) & BS EN ISO 8098 (childrens').
attributes.additional_details: Bicycle handlebar trauma has been well documented in children. Spleen, liver, pancreatic lacerations and renal injuries are the most commonly traumatized sites. Other reported injuries are traumatic abdominal wall hernias and ruptures, aortic rupture, transection of the common bile duct, traumatic arterial occlusion, and groin injuries Presumably, the handlebar of a typical child's bicycle acts as a spear, concentrating what may be a relatively small amount of energy into a focal point of injury.
